title: IGNITE-13605 Basic PDS compatibility test
body:
A simple test to check PDS compatibility of different Ignite versions

Ignite versions "from_version" and "to_version" are set via test parameters

    Start Ignite cluster version "from_version" with PDS enabled
    Start a client application that puts prepared data looks like
    User (1, "John Connor")
    User (2, "Sarah Connor")
    User (3, "Kyle Reese")
    Stop cluster and client
    Start Ignite cluster version "to_version" without PDS clearing
    Start client that reads data and checks that it can be read and have not changed

title: IGNITE-13970 Thin client compatibility test
body:
This PR allows to run ducktape tests for thin client compatibility.

Server and client versions are provided as test parameters, default are dev + latest.
Test runs each client version on each server version and cheks the ordinary cache operations.

title: IGNITE-14464 Released Ignite version removed from default ducktape run
body:
To be able to test Ignite-based products with ducktape tests we should remove the released Ignite version from the default ducktests run.

Tests with the released version should be run with some schedule using external tools such as Jenkins or other CI tool.

title: IGNITE-14463 Support of testing Ignite based products with ducktape tests
body:
This PR allows to run ducktape tests for third party Ignite based tests.

* With `DOCKER_OPTIONS` user can specify additional mount points for docker image.

title: IGNITE-14428 Formalizes the names of the metrics included in the metric registry.
body:
Current PR constraints name of the metrics that can be registered through MetricRegistry#register(Metric) - it must start with the name of metric registry it's registered into.

The purpose of this change is to make all metrics that belongs to one MetricRegistry have the name that obeys mentioned above  rule regardless how they were registered. It helps to use a consistent approach to work with all metrics.

The following metric names was changed to obey this rule:

JoinedNodes -> io.discovery.JoinedNodes 
LeftNodes -> io.discovery.LeftNodes
FailedNodes -> io.discovery.FailedNodes 
PendingMessagesRegistered -> io.discovery.PendingMessagesRegistered
CommunicationErrors -> io.discovery.CommunicationErrors
CurrentTopologyVersion -> io.discovery.CurrentTopologyVersion

title: IGNITE-14353 Ability to specify postfix for IgniteLogger instead of nodeId
body:
This PR adds an ability for Ignite-related application to specify string log file postfix instead of `UUID` nodeId.
It will allow those applications to store their own log files near ignite logs.

title: IGNITE-13399 Fix access right issues in computation of system metrics.
body:
Previously certain Ignite metrics were calculated based on private fields of some internal JVM MBeans. These private fields were accessed via reflection, which lead to errors on Java 9+, thus making the metrics have negative values.
This patch changes the way the required values are retrieved, so that no reflection is used.

title: IGNITE-13582 WAL force rollover timeout introduced
body:
This PR introduces new `DataStorageConfiguration` parameter `walForceArchiveTimeout`.
If this parameter set then Ignite will execute WAL segment rollover each `walForceArchiveTimeout` milliseconds.

This change required to successfully implement [Ignite CDC feature](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/IGNITE/IEP-59+CDC+-+Capture+Data+Change)

title: IGNITE-14335 Merges APIs of IgniteAuthenticationProcessor and IgniteSecurity.
body:
1. Removed an IgniteAuthenticationProcessor that is now treated as an independent processor.
2. Moved the logic of IgniteAuthenticationProcessor into the implementation of the security plugin that is used if authentication is enabled via configuration.
3. Remove duplication of security checks and leave IgniteSecurity as a single security API. 
4. Removed the AuthorizationContext completely.
5. Extended GridSecurityPlugin interface with methods that provide the ability to manage security users.
